business_hypothesis: Shipments marked ready_to_process are substantially more likely to become recognized invoices and represent the quickest path to recoverable revenue.
science_hypothesis: ready_to_process (boolean) has a strong positive association with invoiced_flag after adjusting for canceled, total_charges_n and customer_id fixed effects; logistic regression yields OR ≈ 8.0 (95% CI > 3.5), p < 0.001 and increases model AUC by ≥0.10 when included.
null_case: There is no predictive relationship: P(invoiced_flag=Y | ready_to_process=Y) ≈ P(invoiced_flag=Y | ready_to_process=N) (difference < 2 percentage points), logistic OR ≈ 1.0 with p > 0.10 and inclusion of ready_to_process changes AUC by <0.01.

validation_methods.execution_plan: Compute conditional probabilities P(invoiced_flag=Y | ready_to_process=Y, canceled=F) and P(invoiced_flag=Y | ready_to_process=N, canceled=F) on the full data and report uplift, two-sided z-test and bootstrapped 95% CI. The detector passes if uplift ≥ 40% relative (absolute difference ≥0.20) with p < 0.001 and bootstrap CI does not cross zero.

Build a recency-weighted EWMA series of P(invoiced_flag=Y | ready_to_process=Y) by weekly bill_date cohorts and compare to cohorts with ready_to_process=N to measure persistence across 12 rolling weeks. The scanner passes if the cohort-level uplift persists in ≥ 85% of the most recent 12 weeks with cohort-level effect sizes > 0.15 and cohort stability > 0.85.

Fit a logistic regression of invoiced_flag on ready_to_process plus covariates (canceled, total_charges_n, other_charge_n, customer_id fixed effects) and compute OR, p-value, and AUC via 5-fold CV. The referee passes if the ready_to_process coefficient yields OR ≥ 2.0 (log-OR > ln(2)), p < 0.01 and model AUC ≥ 0.75, with coefficient sign stable across folds.
